title: Emmerdale fans notice baffling blunder as Mandy tries to steal money from Lydia

Emmerdale fans noticed a baffling blunder when Mandy Dingle tried to steal money from Lydia Hart.

On Thursday night's episodes, a solicitor looking for Lydia visited the Dingle house and revealed she had inherited a substantial amount of money.

However, Lydia herself was unaware as Mandy pretended to be the cleaner as part of a sinister new scheme.

Sensing an opportunity to solve her debt problem, Mandy's eyes lit up when the solicitor revealed he had £10,000 to give to Lydia.

But there was a problem, as he wanted some form of identification to prove he was giving money to the right person.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Mandy frantically searched the house for a passport, driving license or letter and was nearly rumbled when Sam and Lydia came home.

Luckily for Mandy, the solicitor didn't say her name and she was not exposed as a fraud.

But viewers couldn't understand how the solicitor didn't realise he was speaking to the wrong person.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

For starters, Lydia Hart isn't even Lydia's actual name, as we discovered she is actually Jenny Finn during her heartbreaking baby storyline.

Her face was splashed all over the news when the bones of a dead baby were found at the school.

So how did the solicitor not know who he was supposed to be looking for?

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Emmerdale viewers took to Twitter to point out the blunder over Lydia's identity.

One viewer said: "I don’t understand it. It was made public knowledge, in the newspapers, who she was. Why this solicitor is coming to her as Lydia, makes no sense to me. Does he live under a rock?"

"I am reliably informed that solicitors who are looking for people normally place an ad in the local paper asking for the whereabouts of someone. Considering Lydia Hart aka Jenny Finn was all over the papers recently because of the buried baby, the world knows her," added another.

A third said: "We're supposed to believe that Lydia 'Jenny Finn' Hart... who had no family to speak of was gifted £10K??? Really #Emmerdale?"

(Image: ITV)

Emmerdale viewers were disgusted by Mandy's sickening actions - and hope she doesn't get away with it.

Taking to Twitter, one viewer said: "Mandy makes me sick. the family will never forgive her if she manages to rip off Lydia."

"Mandy pulling a fast 1 with the lawyer in order to get Lydia's inheritance by saying she's Lydia, talk about sinking low, that lawyer looks shifty to me," added another.

A third said: "Feel for Lydia been undercut by Mandy"

*Emmerdale airs weekday on ITV at 7pm with an extra episode on Thursdays at 8pm
description: Emmerdale viewers were quick to point out a glaring issue when Mandy Dingle pretended to be Lydia Hart
